Title: Ropa Vieja
Ingredients: 3/4 cup pitted brined green olives, sliced
Directions: Heat oil in 12 inch skillet over medium-high until shimmering. Stem, seed, cut bell peppers into 1/2 inch wide strips. Add onions and peppers, cover and cook until softened and spotty brown, 8- 10 minutes

Push veggies to side of skillet. Add tomato paste, garlic, cumin, and oregano to center of skillet and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir tomato paste mixture into vegetables. Stir in wine and cook about 2 minutes; transfer to slow cooker.

Stir soy sauce and bay leaves into slow cooker. Trim and cut steak crosswise against grain into four equal pieces. Season steak with salt and pepper and nestle into cooker. Cover and cook until beef is tender, 6 to 7 hours on low or 4 to 5 hours on high.

Transfer steak to cutting board, then shread into bite-size pieces using 2 forks. Discard bay leaves. Stir beef and olives into slow cooker and let sit until heated through, about 5 minutes. Stir in vinegar and season with salt and pepper to taste.
